title: Terminal to Alert User When Idle

labels.name: *question
labels.description: Issue represents a question, should be posted to StackOverflow (VS Code)

body:
Suggest the terminal shall alert user when it is idle.

Often, we have a large compilation that takes a long time.

I want the terminal to alert me when the compilation has completed. (Hence, idle)

It shall be able to work even if the VS Code is remote SSH.

Thanks.

title: win: self-heal missing 'Open with Code' context menu entries after background update
body:
Adds self-heal logic in build/win32/code.iss to restore missing “Open with Code” context menu registry entries when they disappear after a silent/background update.

**Summary**
- Runs in CurStepChanged at ssPostInstall.
- Recreates file, directory, background, drive verbs if tasks previously selected (or keys existed) and they’re now missing.
- Skips Windows 11 Insiders AppX scenario (existing conditional preserved).
- Logs healing actions; wrapped in try/except to avoid installer failure.

**Rationale**
Users reported losing context menu entries post update; manual PowerShell restore works. This mitigates by automatically re-creating keys.

**Test Plan**
1. Install with context menu tasks selected.
2. Delete keys:
   HKCR\*\shell\VSCode
   HKCR\Directory\shell\VSCode
   HKCR\Directory\Background\shell\VSCode
3. Run updated installer with /VERYSILENT /UPDATE=1.
4. Verify keys restored and installer log contains “Healing VS Code ...”.
5. Confirm no effect if keys present (idempotent) or tasks never chosen.

**Risk**
Low: only writes when keys missing; avoids Insiders AppX path; catches exceptions.

**Follow-ups**
Possible telemetry or unify with modern Windows 11 integration later.

title: Go to Definition resolves to main repo instead of inner Git worktree when both are in workspace

labels.name: *caused-by-extension
labels.description: Issue identified to be caused by an extension

body:
<!-- ⚠️⚠️ Do Not Delete This! bug_report_template ⚠️⚠️ -->
<!-- Please read our Rules of Conduct: https://opensource.microsoft.com/codeofconduct/ -->
<!-- 🕮 Read our guide about submitting issues: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/wiki/Submitting-Bugs-and-Suggestions -->
<!-- 🔎 Search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->
<!-- 🧪 Test using the latest Insiders build to see if your issue has already been fixed: https://code.visualstudio.com/insiders/ -->
<!-- 💡 Instead of creating your report here, use 'Report Issue' from the 'Help' menu in VS Code to pre-fill useful information. -->
<!-- 🔧 Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes/No

<!-- 🪓 If you answered No above, use 'Help: Start Extension Bisect' from Command Palette to try to identify the cause. -->
<!-- 📣 Issues caused by an extension need to be reported directly to the extension publisher. The 'Help > Report Issue' dialog can assist with this. -->

**Environment:**

* VS Code version: latest cursor
* OS: ubuntu docker inside ubuntu remote host

* Git worktree layout:

  ```
  main_repo/              (main branch)
  main_repo/featurebranch (git worktree for branch `feature-branch`)
  ```
* Language: Python

**Steps to Reproduce:**

1. In `main_repo`, create a worktree in a subdirectory:

   ```bash
   cd main_repo
   git worktree add featurebranch feature-branch
   ```
2. Open the `main_repo` folder in VS Code (so it contains both the main branch files and the `featurebranch` directory).
3. In the `featurebranch` folder, open a file containing a function from the feature branch.
4. Use **Ctrl+Click** (Go to Definition) on that function.

**Expected Behavior:**
VS Code should navigate to the definition in the `featurebranch` file (the active worktree branch).


**Actual Behavior:**
VS Code navigates to the definition in the main repo’s copy of the file, ignoring the worktree version.


**Notes:**

* Opening only the `featurebranch` folder works as expected.
* Excluding the main repo’s root from `search.exclude` / `files.exclude` fixes it, but is inconvenient.
* Likely cause: the symbol indexer is not respecting worktree context and resolves to the first match found, which is often in the main repo.

---

**Request:**
When a Git worktree exists inside a repo folder, “Go to Definition” should prefer matches from the same subfolder (worktree) as the file being edited, not from the parent repo copy.

title: Paying for "Sorry, your request failed. Please try again" responses.
body: This issue is noted on Reddit, as well as here in GitHub, i.e.: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode-copilot-release/issues/2314 https://github.com/orgs/community/discussions/154985 Specifically, the issue reads as follows: > Sorry, your request failed. Please try again. Request id: 6f5f8c0b-a691-4dc3-9923-0186e9c9aa8a > Reason: Server error. Stream terminated (Like others have reported, it seems to be more prevalent on Gemini 2.5 Pro.) The issue that I am reporting, however, is that **failed responses are still consuming usage quota**. **I would like to request/propose that customers not be "charged" for failed responses; as they are not a result of user error. We paid for a response, but we did not get that response.** Also, if the cost of these errors is placed on GitHub, my guess is that the team will work more actively to mitigate these errors on their end, and/or deal directly with the model providers (i.e., Google), asking them to fix their issues, and/or not charge GitHub for failed responses. Please consider this change, thank you very much. PS - This error has happened three times in a row, forcing me to change models (though I believe this model is the right one for this particular task).

title: COPILOT - GPT5 - Response is visible but shortened

title: Not getting diagnostic completion as NES for Python

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Issue identified by VS Code Team member as probable bug

labels.name: verified
labels.description: Verification succeeded

labels.name: NES
labels.description: Issues related to the next edit suggestions feature

body:
* Install Python and pylance extension 
* Open an empty workspace folder
* Create a Python file
* Start typing `print(sys.executable)`

99% of the time I don't get an NES for `import sys`
If i import a few other packages and add more lines.
& then type some other code, then (rarely) do i get the NES completion for `import sys`

Note: `sys` is a module that hasn't been imported and can be imported via the diagnostic action

Something doesn't seem to be right with `_hasRecentlyBeenAddedWithoutNES` function as this always returns true.
I think the assumption here is that if `sys` is found in the string, then user may have imported it themselves.

- VS Code Version: 
- OS Version: 

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open a existing workspace in local environment;
2. Add an existing folder in disk driver to the workspace;
3. Folder explorer does not show new folder added in previous step;

5. Remove an existing folder in workspace;
6. The folder in previous is still present in workspace, toggle fresh button does not help in this situation;

title: Iteration Plan for August 2025

labels.name: iteration-plan
labels.description: VS Code - Upcoming iteration plan

body:
This plan captures our work in **August 2025**. This is a 5-week iteration. We will ship in **early September**.

## Endgame
- **September 1, 2025**: Endgame begins
- **September 5, 2025**: Endgame done



The endgame details for this iteration are tracked [here](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues?q=is%3Aissue+label%3Aendgame-plan+milestone%3A%22August+2025%22).

## Plan Items

Below is a summary of the top level plan items.

Legend of annotations:

| Mark                 | Description                                       |
| -------------------- | ------------------------------------------------- |
| :runner:             | work in progress                                  |
| :hand:               | blocked task                                      |
| :muscle:             | stretch goal for this iteration                   |
| :red_circle:         | missing issue reference                           |
| :large_blue_circle:  | more investigation required to remove uncertainty |
| :black_circle:       | under discussion within the team                  |
| :black_large_square: | a large work item, larger than one iteration      |

title: Remote index status stuck on "Checking status"

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Issue identified by VS Code Team member as probable bug

body: Description The "Remote index" status gets stuck on "Checking status" and never completes. Steps to Reproduce 1. Open the GitHub Copilot status. 2. Observe that the "Remote index" status is perpetually "Checking status". Expected Behavior The "Remote index" status should change from "Checking status" to "Ready" or something. Actual Behavior The "Remote index" status remains stuck on "Checking status" indefinitely. Environment Please provide the following information to help debug the issue: Copilot Chat Extension Version: v0.30.0 Version: 1.103.0 (user setup) Commit: e3550cfac4b63ca4eafca7b601f0d2885817fd1f Date: 2025-08-06T21:40:10.271Z Electron: 37.2.3 ElectronBuildId: 12035395 Chromium: 138.0.7204.100 Node.js: 22.17.0 V8: 13.8.500258-electron.0 OS: Windows_NT x64 10.0.26100

title: Position getting reset to top of file

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Issue identified by VS Code Team member as probable bug

labels.name: verified
labels.description: Verification succeeded

labels.name: accessibility
labels.description: Keyboard, mouse, ARIA, vision, screen readers (non-specific) issues

labels.name: confirmed
labels.description: Issue has been confirmed by VS Code Team member

labels.name: regression
labels.description: Something that used to work is now broken

labels.name: insiders-released
labels.description: Patch has been released in VS Code Insiders

body:
Type: Bug 1. Open any file. In my case I opened a markdown file. 2. Move anywhere in the file. For example, I moved to line 43. 3. Press ctrl+g to hear the line number of the position of the cursor. 4. Simply press the escape key. Observing: The cursor is placed at the top of the file. Expectations: The cursor should remain at the position, in this case line 43, that the cursor was set on. This is a huge problem for screen reader users. I have yet to validate if this is happening without a screen reader loaded. It also happens with Narrator and seems to be a cross platform problem as users are reporting issues on program-l. I am hoping we get a fix quickly on this issue as it is quite disruptive. title: Chat timestamp toggel
body:
<!-- ⚠️⚠️ Do Not Delete This! feature_request_template ⚠️⚠️ -->
<!-- Please read our Rules of Conduct: https://opensource.microsoft.com/codeofconduct/ -->
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->

<!-- Describe the feature you'd like. -->
I would like an option to turn timestamps on and off in the AI chat panel within VS Code.  
This would help track **when** messages were sent and calculate **response times** between messages.  

**Details:**
- Add a **toggle setting** in the AI chat interface or settings panel to show/hide timestamps.
- Timestamps could be displayed:
  - As **absolute time** (e.g., `2025-08-10 17:42`)
  - And/or as **relative time** since the last message (e.g., `+2m 15s`).
- This would be especially useful for:
  - Long-running chats
  - Debugging and log tracking
  - Monitoring AI response performance

**Why this is needed:**
Currently, there is no built-in way to see when each message was sent or how long the AI took to respond.  
Adding timestamps would improve clarity, productivity, and debugging workflows.

title: Gemini just made 2130 edits in a row and froze

labels.name: *duplicate
labels.description: Issue identified as a duplicate of another issue(s)

body: Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes - VS Code Version: 1.103.0 - OS Version: Win 10 x64 - Steps to Reproduce: 1. Asked to refactor a file 2. The strangest thing. During file refactoring Gemini in agent mode was asked to make changes to part of the file. All looked promising then it made 2130 edits to the same file in a loop and stopped communicating. The file is 3500+ lines of code hence the refactoring, not sure if that matters. I'll keep the file in case you need a copy of it.
